author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Just an observation.  Installation still leave the previous version in the system.

Environment data
----------------
Windows 10 Insider Build 17083

root@mars:/home/maxt# cat /etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.10
DISTRIB_CODENAME=artful
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 17.10"

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.1> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17083
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS /home/maxt> $PSVersionTable                                                                                          

Name                           Value                                                                                   
----                           -----                                                                                   
PSVersion                      6.0.1                                                                                   
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                    
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1                                                                                  
OS                             Linux 4.13.0-31-generic #34-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 19 16:34:46 UTC 2018                     
Platform                       Unix                                                                                    
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                 
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                     
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                 
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
![pwsh_leftovers_win_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35472990-37d8778a-0347-11e8-8d93-c784476c0489.jpg)

![pwsh_leftovers_linux_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35472995-4502bc18-0347-11e8-80fa-a6618be2bd69.jpg)

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Did you upgrade install or uninstall the old version before installing. I have seen this in the past but to me it seemed that the problem disappeared after the rename to pwsh but I might be wrong. I remember trying to reproduce using clean uninstall and install in the past but could not. I am wondering if this only occurs when someone performs a certain action with the installed product that makes it not remove the folder.

comments.author: RichardSiddaway
comments.body: I did an install of 6.0.1 over the top of 6.0.0 this morning and it removed the 6.0.0 folder

comments.author: RichardSiddaway
comments.body: Now I'm confused because I did an install of 6.0.1 over RC2 and the RC2 part wasn't removed.

comments.author: bergmeister
MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Here's the monkey wrench..  

I have .NETCore AzureRM modules loaded, and a Nuget SMO (.NetCore) package installed.

I would (possibly) expect, on a clean PSCore6 6.0.0 installation, that the next PSSCore6 (6.0.1) update could (possibly) remove the previous version.

In my situation, I had 6.0.0 and updated to 6.0.1. 

Also, I remember a known issue when doing the Update-Help, The installation won't remove the folder due to the existing help files.

To Repo... Have anyone try the following:
1. Install clean pswh 6.0.0.
2. Executed the "Update-Help" command
3. Then, install the latest version 6.0.1.

See if this helps. 

:)

![pwsh_leftovers_win_01_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35485192-e5b6f632-0429-11e8-81f9-235855ec8498.jpg)

![pwsh_leftovers_win_02_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35485193-ec6c6822-0429-11e8-95dc-e2032b65ae1d.jpg)

![pwsh_leftovers_linux_01_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35485400-496b97ca-042d-11e8-9a07-0e8cda0a8546.jpg)

![pwsh_leftovers_linux_02_2018-01-27_9-40-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/35485404-4f610d36-042d-11e8-9ae6-c5a81d68a1ea.jpg)

title: PSCore6 - Still installer won't remove previous version from system.
